tournament.name: Duel Commander - Academia de jogos (São Paulo, Brazil)

decks.notes: The deck revolves around utilizing Vial Smasher the Fierce as the commander to deal damage to opponents whenever a spell is cast. The main focus is on controlling the board and disrupting opponents with a wide range of counterspells, removal spells, and versatile instant-speed cards. By efficiently managing resources and being proactive in casting spells, the deck aims to pressure opponents with a combination of burn spells, creature threats, and card advantage engines like Snapcaster Mage and Jace, the Mind Sculptor. The land base is optimized for consistent mana fixing and the inclusion of dual lands to support the deck's color requirements. Overall, the strategy is to maintain control of the game while steadily chipping away at opponents' life totals with Vial Smasher's ability.

The primary strategy of this deck revolves around using Breya, Etherium Shaper as the commander to control the board and disrupt opponents while assembling powerful artifact synergies. By utilizing a mix of mana rocks, tutors, card draw spells, and removal, the deck aims to establish a dominant position and generate incremental advantages over time. Breya's ability to sacrifice artifacts for various effects, combined with support cards like Tezzeret, Agent of Bolas, enables efficient answers to threats and recursion of important pieces. Ultimately, the goal is to outvalue opponents through resource management, interaction, and proactive game plan execution, leading to a favorable position in the late game.

The main focus of this control deck is to manipulate and control the game through counterspells, card draw, and tempo plays. Utilizing cards like Force of Will, Cryptic Command, and Force Spike, the goal is to disrupt the opponent's game plan and protect your own win conditions. Card advantage is key, with spells like Fact or Fiction, Glimmer of Genius, and Future Sight providing card selection and advantage. The inclusion of high tide and various extra turn spells like Temporal Mastery and Time Warp allow for explosive plays and overwhelming the opponent. Overall, the strategy is to outsmart and outlast the opponent with a mix of control elements and powerful card advantage to secure victory.

This aggressive deck focuses on utilizing Vial Smasher the Fierce's ability to deal damage to opponents whenever you cast your high CMC spells. The deck is packed with powerful instant and sorcery spells, as well as plenty of burn spells and removal to control the board and disrupt your opponent's game plan. With a mix of card advantage, disruption, and efficient threats, the goal is to apply early pressure and maintain a strong board presence while burning your opponent out for the win. The deck's mana base also ensures consistent access to the necessary colors to cast your spells effectively and efficiently.

This deck aims to control the game by utilizing a wide range of removal spells, disruptive creatures, and card advantage engines. With Atraxa as the commander, the deck focuses on maintaining board presence and keeping the opponent's threats in check. It includes a mix of versatile removal spells like Swords to Plowshares and Vindicate, alongside powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Liliana of the Veil. The creature base is filled with utility creatures that can disrupt the opponent's strategy, such as Meddling Mage and Thalia, Heretic Cathar. The deck also includes various mana accelerants to ensure that it can cast its spells efficiently and consistently control the game.

This deck revolves around utilizing Selvala, Heart of the Wilds' ability to generate large amounts of mana quickly, allowing for explosive plays and combos. The key strategy is to ramp up mana production with cards like Utopia Sprawl and Nykthos, Shrine to Nyx, while also utilizing creatures like Priest of Titania and Rofellos, Llanowar Emissary to further accelerate mana generation. The deck includes powerful threats like Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger and Emrakul, the Aeons Torn, which can be summoned quickly thanks to the deck's fast mana production. Additionally, the deck includes ways to search for key combo pieces and protect the commander with cards like Concordant Crossroads and Lightning Greaves. The ultimate goal is to overwhelm the opponent with massive threats and mana advantage.

This deck focuses on ramping up quickly with mana dorks and land fetching cards to get Titania, Protector of Argoth out as soon as possible. Once Titania is on the battlefield, the deck aims to go wide with token generation and pump up those tokens with cards like Avenger of Zendikar and Craterhoof Behemoth to overwhelm the opponent with an aggressive strategy. The deck also includes ways to protect its key pieces with cards like Sylvan Safekeeper and Reclamation Sage to deal with opposing threats. Overall, the deck's key strategy is to establish a strong board presence and quickly close out the game with a powerful alpha strike.

The main concept of this aggressive deck is to utilize the powerful abilities of Vial Smasher the Fierce along with a mix of efficient removal spells, burn spells, and aggressive creatures to quickly deal damage to the opponent in a Duel Commander 1 vs 1 format. The deck contains a variety of utility creatures such as Fauna Shaman and Eternal Witness to provide card advantage and flexibility. Additionally, the deck includes powerful planeswalkers like Chandra, Torch of Defiance and ramp cards like Birds of Paradise to help accelerate mana production and maintain pressure on the opponent. The deck aims to apply early pressure, disrupt opponent's strategies with removal spells, and ultimately close out the game with direct damage or combat damage.
